details.title: Maharashtra CM Uddhav requests PM Modi to reduce oxygen prices, increase suppy amid rising cases
details.content:
Asking the Centre to provide all possible help, Maharashtra chief minister Uddhav Thackeray told Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday that the state may face shortage of oxygen due to rising COVID-19 cases.

This request was made after PM Modi, who convened a video conference on Wednesday, addressed chief ministers of seven states, including Uddhav Thackeray, to asses COVID-19 siatuation  (READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: DMDK chief, founder Vijayakant tests positive for COVID-19
details.content:
A media bulletin issued by the MIOT Hospital said Vijayakant was tested positive for COVID on September 22.

"He is completely stable and admitted to MIOT Hospitals, Chennai. He is expected to make a full recovery and should be ready for discharge soon," the hospital said in its bulletin.

details.title: Telangana records 2,176 new cases of COVID-19, total tally reaches 1,79,246
details.content:
Telangana recorded 2,176 new cases of COVID-19 on Wednesday, of the 55,318 tests that it conducted. As on Thursday morning, reports of 1,388 tests were still awaited. 

The number of active cases in the state currently stands at 30,037, of whom 23,929 are under home quarantine. The total number of COVID-19 cases detected in the state till now is 1,79,246. 

(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Over 3 lakh challans issued by Delhi Police for violation of COVID-19 norms
details.content:
The Delhi Police has issued more than three lakh challans between June 15 and September 23 for violation of COVID-19 norms in the national capital, officials said on Thursday.

A total of 3,54,944 challans were issued from June 15 till Wednesday, they said.(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Himachal records 61 new cases
details.content:
Himachal Pradesh records 61 new #COVID19 cases, taking the total positive cases in the state to 13,110 so far, including 3,771 active cases, 9,172 recoveries & 141 deaths: State Health Department, Govt of Himachal Pradesh pic.twitter.com/CYyiF0ZwTD

— ANI (@ANI) September 24, 2020

details.title: Puducherry reports highest single-day COVID-19 spike with 668 cases, tally at 24,895
details.content:
The highest single-day spike of 668 COVID-19 cases and six deaths were reported in Puducherry in the last 24 hours, taking the total cases to 24,895, active cases to 5097, and deaths at 487 on Thursday. So far 19,311 COVID infected persons have recovered. The earlier single-day highest spike of 604 COVID cases were reported on August 28 along with nine deaths

(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Manish Sisodia's condition stable, to undergo another COVID-19 test in couple of days
details.content:
The condition of Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia, currently undergoing treatment for COVID-19 at a state-run facility here, is stable, and he will undergo another coronavirus test in a couple of days, officials said on Thursday.

He was admitted to the LNJP Hospital on Wednesday from being under home isolation after he had contracted the infection.

"He is still in ICU since yesterday (Wednesday), but his condition is stable. The minister has been put on oxygen support, and under constant observation," a senior doctor of the hospital said.(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: 'My Family My Responsibility' campaign entails door-to-door survey: Maharashtra CMO
details.content:
'My Family My Responsibility' campaign entails door-to-door survey for tracing & treating COVID-19 patients, identifying people with co-morbidities, raising awareness & educating citizens on safety measures to break the chain of transmission: Chief Minister's Office, Maharashtra pic.twitter.com/BVEj27hhQh

— ANI (@ANI) September 24, 2020

details.title: Veteran Atomic scientist succumbs to COVID in Kolkata
details.content: Veteran atomic scientist and former chairman of Atomic Energy Commission Dr Sekhar Basu succumbs to COVID19 at a private hospital in Kolkata. He was 68.

details.title: Goa film festival postponed due to COVID: Javadekar
details.content: International Film Festival of India, scheduled in Goa from November 20-28, postponed to January 16-24, 2021. IFFI to be held in hybrid format, virtual and physical; COVID-related international film festival guidelines to be followed: I&B Minister Prakash Javadekar

details.title: SC issues notice to Centre, UPSC on plea seeking postponement of exams
details.content: Supreme Court seeks response from Centre and Union Public Service Commission on plea seeking postponement of civil services 2020 examination in view of floods and rise in COVID19 cases.

details.title: 75 per cent of 86,508 COVID-19 cases in 24 hours concentrated in 10 states/UTs: Health ministry
details.content: Seventy-five per cent of the 86,508 COVID-19 cases reported in a span of 24 hours in the country are concentrated in 10 states and Union territories, including Maharashtra, Karnataka, Andhra Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh, Tamil Nadu, Delhi and Chhattisgarh, the health ministry said on Thursday. Maharashtra continues to top this list. It has alone contributed to more than 21,000 cases, followed by Andhra Pradesh and Karnataka with more than 7,000 and 6,000 coronavirus cases, respectively.

details.title: Basvakalyan MLA Narayan Rao succumbs to COVID-19
details.content:
Basvakalyan MLA Narayan Rao who was admitted to Manipal Hospital with Severe COVID-19 infection passed away at 3.55 pm. He was 65 yrs old, had multi-organ failure, was on multiple supports including ventilator in the ICU. @XpressBengaluru @NewIndianXpress

— Ranjani (@ranjanikanth_) September 24, 2020

details.title: Uttar Pradesh COVID tally
details.content: Uttar Pradesh reports 4,674 new COVID19 cases, 67 more fatalities. Infection tally goes up to 3,84,277, death toll now 5,366. Number of active cases in the state stands at 61,300.

details.title: Durga Puja 2020 during COVID
details.content: During Durga Puja, a pandal needs to be open from all four sides. Hand sanitisers should be placed at entry points of pandals, & wearing of masks to be mandatory. Physical distancing needs to be maintained. Organising cultural programs at pandals won't be allowed. Durga Puja committees to get Rs 50,000 each as a grant from the state government. 80,000 hawkers to receive one-time grant of Rs 2000 ahead of Durga Puja: West Bengal CM

details.title: Maharashtra Police sees 161 more cops testing positive for virus
details.content: 161 police personnel of Maharashtra Police tested positive for COVID-19 and 1 died in the last 24 hours, taking the total number of infections in the state force to 21,988 including 3,381 active cases, 18,372 recovered cases, and 235 deaths: Maharasthra Police

details.title: COVID-19 patient goes 'missing' from Pune hospital; kin protest
details.content:
While the Pune Municipal Corporation said the woman was discharged from the hospital on September 5, her relatives have filed a missing person's complaint at Shivajinagar police station here in Maharashtra. The woman was admitted to the hospital, located at the College of Engineering Pune (COEP) ground, on August 29 after testing positive for coronavirus, her mother told reporters.

FULL REPORT HERE

details.title: Protests erupt over COVID suicide case in Shimla
details.content: Congress workers stage a protest outside Deen Dayal Upadhyaya Zonal Hospital in Shimla where a female COVID-19 patient died by suicide allegedly due to lack of facilities.

details.title: Jammu and Kashmir reports 1,104 new COVID19 cases
details.content: Jammu and Kashmir reports 1,104 new COVID19 cases and 1,549 recoveries today, taking the total tally in the union territory to 68,614, including 48,079 recoveries and 1,084 deaths. Active cases stand at 19,451: Government of Jammu and Kashmir

details.title: Dharavi COVID count  rises by 15 more cases
details.content: Coronavirus case count in Mumbai's Dharavi area rises to 3,102 with 15 new cases: civic body

details.title: Lawyers' body seeks Rs 20 lakh loan, interest waiver due to pandemic, SC seeks credentials
details.content: The Supreme Court Thursday asked for the credentials of a lawyers' body seeking direction to the Centre to waive interest on loan to its members and granting Rs 20 lakh credit to the association on account of financial problems faced due to the pandemic.

details.title: COVID-19 affected woman delivers quadruplets in UP's Gorakhpur, one baby on ventilator
details.content: A coronavirus positive woman delivered four babies at BRD Medical College in Uttar Pradesh's Gorakhpur district, officials said on Thursday. "While three babies are healthy, the fourth one is on a ventilator. The mother is also healthy," BRD Medical College Principal Ganesh Kumar said.

details.title: Second wave of COVID-19 has hit its peak in Delhi, number of cases to decline in coming days: Arvind Kejriwal
details.content: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday said the second wave of the coronavirus pandemic has hit its peak in the national capital with experts hinting that the cases of infection will decline in the coming days.

details.title: Ministry of Health's eSanjeevani OPD completes 3 lakh tele-consultations within 6 months of launch
details.content: The Ministry of Health's eSanjeevani OPD platform has completed three lakh tele-consultations within six months of its launch, with four states -- Tami Nadu, Uttar Pradesh, Kerala and Uttarakhand -- accounting for nearly 90 per cent of use by beneficiaries. The eSanjeevani OPD services have enabled patient-to-doctor telemedicine in the midst of the COVID-19 pandemic, the ministry said.

details.title: 19,164 new coronavirus cases in Maharashtra, 459 deaths
details.content: Maharashtra's coronavirus case tally rose to 12,82,963 on Thursday with addition of 19,164 cases, the state health department said. With 459 fatalities being reported during the day, the death toll in the state reached 34,345, it said.

details.title: Gujarat reports 1,408 new COVID-19 cases; 1,410 discharged
details.content: Gujarat's coronavirus tally rose to 1,28,949 with the addition of 1,408 new cases on Thursday, the state health department said. With 14 more deaths, the COVID-19 toll in the state increased to 3,384, it said.

details.title: Nagpur records 1,126 new COVID-19 cases; 44 more deaths
details.content: As many as 1,126 persons tested positive for coronavirus, while 44 died of the infection in Maharashtra's Nagpur district on Thursday, an official said. With the fresh infections, the district's caseload has risen to 71,616, the official said.

details.title: 1,793 COVID-19 positive cases were reported in Punjab today
details.content:
A total of 1793, COVID-19 positive cases were reported today in Punjab, taking the state’s total tally to 1,05,220 cases, while 81,475 discharged/recovered and 3066 have died till date#Pb @Newindianxpress, @SundayStandard, @TheMornStandard

— Harpreet Singh Bajwa (@Harpreet_TNIE) September 24, 2020

details.title: Agitations during COVID-19 period will be 'detrimental' and 'ill-timed': Puducherry Lt Governor Kiran Bedi
details.content: Puducherry Lt Governor Kiran Bedi on Thursday said disturbing recovery situation during the ongoing COVID-19 period by staging agitations would be 'highly detrimental' and 'ill timed'.

details.title: 183 new coronavirus cases in Ahmedabad, three deaths
details.content: Ahmedabad reported 183 new coronavirus cases on Thursday, raising the number of cases in the district to 35,671, the Gujarat health department said. The district reported three COVID-19 deaths, increasing the toll to 1,810, it said.

details.title: Kolkata Metro mulling increasing frequency of trains
details.content: The Kolkata Metro Railway is planning to increase the frequency of services during peak hours from 10 minutes at present to 8 minutes, a senior official said on Thursday. It is also contemplating augmenting the number of services in a day to carry more passengers, he said.

details.title: Mumbai records 2,163 COVID-19 cases; 54 die, 1,550 recover
details.content: Mumbai reported 2,163 new COVID- 19 cases on Thursday, taking its tally to 1,92,301, while the death toll rose to 8,655 with 54 fresh fatalities, the city civic body said. The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) said the number of recoveries increased to 1,55,638 with 1,550 more patients getting discharged from hospitals in the last 24 hours.

details.title: COVID-19: 76 deaths, 1,793 new cases in Punjab
details.content: Seventy-six more people died from coronavirus in Punjab on Thursday as 1,793 new infections surfaced, taking the state's case tally to 1,05,220. So far, the disease has claimed 3,066 lives in the state.

details.title: 22 deaths, 1,698 fresh virus cases in Haryana
details.content: Haryana on Thursday reported 22 more coronavirus deaths as 1,698 fresh cases pushed the state's infection tally to 1,18,554. So far, 1,255 people have died from the infection in the state.

details.title: Mumbai records 2,163 COVID-19 cases; 54 die, 1,550 recover
details.content: Mumbai reported 2,163 new COVID- 19 cases on Thursday, taking its tally to 1,92,301, while the death toll rose to 8,655 with 54 fresh fatalities, the city civic body said. The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) said the number of recoveries increased to 1,55,638 with 1,550 more patients getting discharged from hospitals in the last 24 hours.

details.title: 7,710 new coronavirus cases in Karnataka, 65 deaths
details.content: Karnataka on Thursday registered 7,710 fresh cases of COVID-19 and 65 related fatalities, taking the total number of infections to 5.48 lakh and the toll to 8,331, the health department said.

details.title: Surat district reports 278 COVID-19 cases, 276 recoveries
details.content: Surat reported 278 fresh COVID-19 cases on Thursday, the highest for a district in Gujarat, taking its tally to 26,415, the state health department said. The district registered five fatalities, also the highest in the state, taking its death toll to 918, the department said in a release.

details.title: Sumangali Auditorium in Kozhikode getting converted into 206-bed COVID-19 treatment centre
details.content:
With #COVID19 cases in Kerala spiking every day, Sumangali Auditorium at Panniyankara in Kozhikode is getting converted into 206-bed #COVID19 treatment centre to treat patients.

Express Photo | @manumavelil @xpresskerala pic.twitter.com/wV3ct3Fzuf

— The New Indian Express (@NewIndianXpress) September 24, 2020

details.title: Nagaland reports more recoveries than new COVID-19 cases
details.content: Single-day recoveries outnumbered new COVID-19 cases in Nagaland on Thursday as 89 people were cured of the disease and 59 tested positive for the infection, Health Minister S Pangnyu Phom said.

details.title: AAP government in Delhi High Court on issue to reserve 80 per cent ICU beds in private hospitals
details.content: The AAP government has challenged in the Delhi High Court its single judge order staying the reservation of 80 per cent ICU beds for COVID-19 patients. The single judge on September 22 had stayed the Delhi government's September 12 direction to 33 private hospitals to reserve 80 per cent of ICU beds for COVID-19 patients and asked whether other patients had a right to life.

details.title: 62 more fatalities push West Bengal's COVID-19 toll to 4,606
details.content: West Bengal's COVID-19 death toll jumped to 4,606 on Thursday with 62 more fatalities, while 3,196 new infections pushed the coronavirus tally to 2,37,869, a bulletin issued by the health department said.

details.title: Telangana to resume interstate, city bus services from September 25
details.content: After a gap of over six months, the Telangana government has decided to resume bus services in the city from September 25. Inter-state bus services from Telangana to Karnataka and Maharashtra will also be restarted from Friday, an official release said on Thursday.

details.title: 2,304 new coronavirus cases in Madhya Pradesh, 45 deaths, 2,327 recover
details.content: Madhya Pradesh on Thursday saw 2,304 new coronavirus cases being reported, which took the case count in the state to 1,15,361, the health department said. The death toll due to the pandemic went up to 2,122 with 45 fatalities during the past 24 hours, it said in a statement in the evening.
